org.smartfrog.sfcore.workflow.combinators
Class FireBreak

java.lang.Object
  org.smartfrog.sfcore.reference.RemoteReferenceResolverHelperImpl
      org.smartfrog.sfcore.prim.PrimImpl
          org.smartfrog.sfcore.compound.CompoundImpl
              org.smartfrog.sfcore.workflow.eventbus.EventCompoundImpl
                  org.smartfrog.sfcore.workflow.combinators.Parallel
                      org.smartfrog.sfcore.workflow.combinators.FireBreak
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.rmi.Remote, MessageKeys, RemoteTags, RemoteTagsComponent, Compound, ChildMinder, Diagnostics, Liveness, Prim, Update, RemoteReferenceResolver, RemoteReferenceResolverHelper, EventAware, EventBus, EventCompound, EventRegistration, EventSink
public class FireBreak
extends Parallel
implements Compound

FireBreak is a modified Parallel that when a sub-components terminates, it simply removes itself from its parent and then terminates.

The file firebreak.sf contains the SmartFrog configuration file for the base FireBreak combinator. This file contains the details of the attributes which may be passed to FireBreak.

Method Detail

onChildTerminated

protected boolean onChildTerminated(TerminationRecord status,
                                    Prim comp)
It simply detaches itself from its parent and then terminates

Overrides:
onChildTerminated in class Parallel
Parameters:
status - exit record of the component
comp - child component that is terminating
Returns:
true if the termination event is to be forwarded up the chain.

sfLivenessFailure

protected void sfLivenessFailure(java.lang.Object source,
                                 java.lang.Object target,
                                 java.lang.Throwable failure)
Handle ping failures. Default behavior is to terminate with a liveness send failure record storing the name of the target of the ping when the failure comes from the parent. If the failure comes from one of the children, the component removes itself from its parent and then terminates.

Overrides:
sfLivenessFailure in class PrimImpl
Parameters:
source - source of update
target - target that update was trying to reach
failure - error that occurred
